title: Archibald John Motley Jr. Nightlife Matted Notecard
description:
Print developed from Archibald John Motley Jr.’s Nightlife, 1943, from the Art Institute of Chicago’s

Nightlife depicts a crowded cabaret in the South Side neighborhood of Bronzeville in Chicago. The dynamic composition and heightened colors vividly express the liveliness of the scene, making Nightlife one of Motley’s most celebrated paintings.

  • Print Reproduction
  • Image Dimensions:  4.5 x 6 in.
  • Full Dimensions:  8 x 10 in. 
  • Material:  Premium cardstock
